alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 4:51PM EST until February 27 at 5:45PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Orange County in central Vermont... Rutland County in southern Vermont... Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 545 PM EST. * At 448 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Newbury Village to near Sudbury to near West Haven, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Visibility of less than one quarter mile in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Multiple videos have confirmed whiteout conditions within this snow squall. Observed wind gusts of up to 40 MPH have been reported by ASOS and mesonet. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 25. Interstate 91 south of Bradford. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Chester, Woodstock, Killington, Thetford Hill State Park, Ludlow Village, Rutland City, Wallingford, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Pomfret, Plymouth, Thetford, Hartland, Chittenden, West Rutland, Ira, Fairlee, West Castleton, Tunbridge and Mount Holly. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
